file_content.text: Disaster is averted--for now.
You're back. I hope you sealed the chambers of the ancients? Kel'eth Ur's chamber especially....
I'm terrified to think what would happen if Kel'eth Ur and his crazed ideas were to re-emerge!
His secrets have been destroyed forever.
Don't worry.
There was a holo, but the message is destroyed.
I did find something.
Kel'eth Ur was nobody--some Sith who turned light side.
You had nothing to fear.
Do not underestimate the power of the light, which eternally seeks to destroy us.
Kel'eth Ur's secrets have been contained, along with the other ancients. You have done well.
Actually, I brought something from Kel'eth Ur here.
Well, there was this.
I think his secrets are worth examining.
I disagree.
Kel'eth Ur's image asked me to bring this to you.
Um, well, let me explain.
What--what's this? How could you--?
I want no part of this! Please, destroy it! Bury it! Seal it away!
I don't understand.
What's the problem?
We can learn something from this--and become powerful.
You're wrong.
Clearly, you don't understand. Throughout history, the light has endeavored to destroy the darkness.
The Emperor was right to murder Kel'eth Ur for his heresy. Peace, serenity--words for the stifling of the very emotions that drive us.
Wouldn't it be wise to learn the teachings of our enemy?
Knowledge is strength.
No! That's not--wait--yes--I think I understand your reasoning.
Fine, I will take the teachings of Kel'eth Ur and study them so that the darkness may prevail over the light.
I have no patience for this.
Fine. I will take the teachings and see that they are locked away.
I thought what Kel'eth Ur said was very wise.
That's your belief, not mine.
You have been deceived.
But perhaps it would be best if I took them and kept them... hidden. Give them to me!
Now please leave. The temple is safe, and I must take these teachings back to my chambers and make sure they're... secure.
Hurry! If the ancients' chambers are breached, all of Dromund Kaas is in danger!
You, mercenary. You were let through? Has someone finally decided to secure the temple?
At last, the Dark Council has answered my petitions and sent a fine young Sith to help secure the temple!
At last, the Dark Council has answered my petitions and sent a powerful fighting Sith to help secure the temple!
You look like an Imperial Intelligence agent--hardly what I would have expected the Dark Council to send to secure the temple.
Well, what have we here? Has someone finally decided to secure the temple?
I'm not here to secure the temple.
I'm here on other business.
Whoa, slow down.
I'm just here to check the plumbing.
Don't be ridiculous.
Of course. I've been ignored again. How stupid of me.
If you're here, however, you must have the authority to enter the Dark Temple. You could still save this planet.
Saving people isn't usually what I do.
Not really my thing.
Then you have missed a great avenue for glory.
Go on.
What are you babbling about, old man?
You're crazy.
You're a brave one, aren't you? Or is it that you sense my weakness? But not everything grows weaker with age.
The Dark Temple is ancient, built during a previous incarnation of our Empire. A thousand years ago, our own Emperor buried his enemies here.
These enemies remain powerful, even in death--which is why the temple was sealed. But now something terrible has happened.
Some idiot went and woke them up?
Let me guess.
Why bury the enemies of the Emperor with honor?
I'm not sure I understand.
To appease them if they were to wake, of course.
Uh-oh.
With the Emperor's attention elsewhere, a group of ambitious, but ignorant, Sith thought to gain power by raiding the temple.
They didn't find the relics they sought. Instead, they awoke an ancient Sith Lord--Lord Kallig--and their expedition plunged into madness.
What was this expedition? How many people were lost?
Expedition?
At least a hundred. Several Sith, slaves, soldiers, experts. All stupid.
Are they still in there?
Where are they now?
The ones who still live, yes.
If I go in, will I go mad, too?
What about me?
Not necessarily. Many of the troops sent in after were simply slaughtered.
Because Lord Kallig died by ambush, I believe he awakened unaware of his own death, and his expectations became reality for those around him.
His power overwhelmed all inside the temple, and even now the workers plot wars against each other, believing themselves Sith Lords and drawing terrible power from Kallig himself.
Are there more dead Sith Lords in there?
What if he's not the only one?
Ah, you begin to see the crisis.
How do we stop them?
I care not about the fighting itself, only what it may cause.
Blah blah blah.
You are lucky I have no other to turn to in this dark time.
There are still more ancient Sith Lords whose spirits lay dormant in the temple.
If the ancient Sith Lords are woken by the violence within, they could overrun Dromund Kaas.
Let's keep them napping.
Then we should stop them.
Maybe that won't happen.
Don't be so pessimistic.
We are not going to be saved by optimism, young one.
I was just thinking of getting off this planet.
Maybe I should leave.
If the other ancients awake and escape, there will be nowhere in the galaxy safe from their wrath.
I have studied all of the burial chambers within. Each was made with the same ancient design, one we can exploit.
If you fuse the 500-kilogram hinges on each tomb door, even a violent assault should not be able to wake the ancients.
How does that work?
I don't see why I should bother.
This isn't my problem.
There is nobody else! Imagine the glory, being the one who prevented the Emperor's greatest enemies from rising!
Don't worry.
That will not stop the next group of idiots from putting us right back in this situation.
The team I sent in earlier was using a massive metal torch. Effective but slow, I'm afraid. They did not make it far.
The torch must be recovered, and the doors of the ancients sealed!
I don't think you're cleared to be here... more's the pity.
